thread.title: Seth Meyers parodies awards show darlings in 'Oscar Bait'
thread.title_full: Seth Meyers parodies awards show darlings in 'Oscar Bait'

author: USA TODAY
title: Seth Meyers parodies awards show darlings in 'Oscar Bait'
text:
Seth Meyers parodies awards show darlings in 'Oscar Bait' Erin Jensen, USA TODAY 8:18 a.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 
Finally, a movie that's honest about what it is: "a film that's not afraid to pander to your emotions." 
Oscar Bait starring Late Night's own Seth Meyers, plays into every fathomable clich√© that can be found in movies that typically do well during awards show season. Equipped with "racial tension, latent homosexuality, and a man staring at trains," a dramatic voice-over promises, this "film" that portrays a man's courageous battle with "balloon foot" certainly has themes that would make it a contender. Oscar predictions: Who will win, who should win 
Also, don't say we didn't warn you about the emotional mailman who shed tears though "he was literally on screen for two seconds," because clearly a "critic" at USA TODAY attempted to give audiences the heads up, as documented in the comical clip above.
